bug.author: apc999
bug.summary: Docker does not work with certain property keys
bug.description: Alluxio Version: 2.0.0-SNAPSHOT Describe the bug $ bin/alluxio runClass alluxio.cli.GetConfKey ALLUXIO_MASTER_MOUNT_TABLE_ROOT_OPTION_AWS_ACCESSKEYID alluxio.master.mount.table.root.option.aws.accesskeyid and alluxio.master.mount.table.root.option.aws.accesskeyid will not work but only alluxio.master.mount.table.root.option.aws.accessKeyId will work To Reproduce passing ALLUXIO_MASTER_MOUNT_TABLE_ROOT_OPTION_AWS_ACCESSKEYID as the property to docker Expected behavior We should have one way to pass the property Urgency High Additional context One solution might be making Alluxio properties case independent by fixing alluxio.conf.PropertyKey#isValid and alluxio.conf.PropertyKey#fromString

comments.comment: As an alternative solution, instead of relying on camel case I think we should always . between words as is convention for (probably) > 90% of the property keys. I think we should follow the same convention for all keys. While not affected by the casing of the characters I'm specifically thinking about tiered storage keys that use level0, level1, etc.. instead of level.0, level.1...

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ZacBlanco>@ZacBlanco</denchmark-link> , I discussed this issue with <denchmark-link:https://github.com/aaudiber>@aaudiber</denchmark-link> , another approach might be just pass all properties to through env variable like , or . Then we don't need to modify the code but only the recommended way to run docker. Independently, we agree with you that, we should have the same convention to name all keys.

Looks like there are some keys that must be in mixed cases
alluxio/shell/src/main/java/alluxio/cli/GetConfKey.java
Line 31 in 12d159a
.put("AWS_ACCESSKEYID", "aws.accessKeyId")
I think we should just use JAVA_OPTS for everything.
Created <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio/pull/8993>#8993</denchmark-link> to support spaces in environment variables, and also recommend using for everything
Both 1.8 branch and master branch have this fix. Close this ticket now
